title: WCAS HISTORY 392-0-32 Topics In History
topic: Extreme Makeover: The End of Consensus and the Ris

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course will consider the causes and consequences of the end of the Cold War consensus in American life between the defeat of Lyndon Johnson in 1968 and the election of Ronald Reagan in 1980. It will argue that this era of the "long 1970s" saw the end of political consensus and the emergence of a newly hyper-partisan politics has defined U.S. politics ever since.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: EVALUATION METHOD: Class participation (30%), short written work (20%), two papers (50%)
